meanings.definition: To walk at a steady speed, especially without stopping.
meanings.sent1: She paced back and forth in the room, trying to calm her nerves.
meanings.sent2: The soldier paced along the border, keeping watch for any intruders.
meanings.sent3: The cat paced around the house, pretending to be the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: Time paced slowly as she waited for the test results, each second feeling like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: His heart paced with excitement as he approached the finish line of the race.

meanings.definition: To set the speed at which something happens or progresses.
meanings.sent1: The coach paced the team's training sessions to ensure gradual improvement.
meanings.sent2: The conductor paced the music, guiding the orchestra through a beautiful performance.
meanings.sent3: The teacher paced the lesson perfectly, keeping the students engaged and interested.
meanings.sent4: Her breathing paced the rhythm of the dance, syncing perfectly with the music.
meanings.sent5: The clock's ticking paced the suspense of the movie, building tension with each passing minute.

meanings.definition: To measure the distance between two points.
meanings.sent1: He paced the length of the room to estimate how much paint he would need.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor paced the land carefully, marking each point with precision.
meanings.sent3: The child paced the sidewalk, counting each step to see how far he could go.
meanings.sent4: The explorer paced the distance between the two mountains, planning the trek ahead.
meanings.sent5: The architect paced the area, envisioning where each building would stand in the future.
